intro: Fridericia prancei, commonly known as the Prance's frostweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Fridericia prancei is adapted to cold, harsh environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
